job.title: Software Engineer - Back End
job.description:
Are you interested in applying your Software Engineering experience to advance cancer diagnostics? If so, we encourage you to put your experience and innovative spirit to work at Leica Biosystems! This position requires an innovative engineer who will work closely with key partners to build exciting and reliable experiences using web, thick-client applications or micro­services.
We are looking for a passionate backend engineer to help support our growing business! In this position, you will be a valued member of a technical team charged with implementing interactive features and user-friendly designs for the industry’s rapid migration to Digital Pathology. Use your intellect and experience to build applications supporting the entire workflow, from image acquisition all the way through image management, image review, and analysis.
Join us to help take this new form of medical imaging to the next level!
Major Responsibilities
Champion projects through all stages of the software lifecycle – inception, requirements, design, implementation, documentation, and verification. In this role, you will serve as a technology expert responsible for driving the backend technology of our products forward. You will provide technical guidance and hands on experience to the engineering team.
Key responsibilities include:
Collaborating with Product Management and other Software Engineers to develop Digital Pathology data workflow, management and viewing applications.
Taking ownership of the backend tech stack, creating solutions for advancing our architecture, unit testing, and continuous integration and deployment.
Learning and applying DBS (Danaher Business Systems) tools and processes for product quality, on time delivery and problem solving, ultimately driving to improve customer satisfaction
Writing unit tests and driving verification and validation activities per a tightly controlled quality system.
Contributing to Design Documentation and defend design decisions in critical design reviews.
Lead development projects and mentor software engineers on your team
Providing third-tier support for customer installations.
Qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, related technical field OR, equivalent practical experience
4+ years software development experience using .NET technologies
2+ years of MS SQL Server development
2+ years of experience creating automated unit tests using MS Test and MOQ (or equivalent)
Experience in building microservices
Experience in software development with messaging queue/bus/broker systems (RabbitMQ)
Experience designing secure services to accommodate industry standards in data protection and privacy
Experience with DevOps, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment and automation
Location
This is a remote role but may require travel to the office in Vista, CA
What We Have To Offer
Check out our benefits here: https://danaherbenefitsinfo.com/
All employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment drug screening and background/criminal check.
Diversity Statement
At Danaher, we are dedicated to building and sustaining a truly diverse and inclusive culture. These are not just words on a page—Diversity and Inclusion is a top priority for the company, and it ties deeply to each of our core values. Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law.
This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. The incumbent is expected to perform other duties necessary for the effective operation of the department or unit. This job description may be changed at any time
Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The “EEO is the Law” poster is available here.
When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful
Danaher Business System
tools and the stability of a tested organization.
Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. We value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
